RAIN and SPN are collaborating to increase promotion of RWH for variety of uses with the optimal participation of local people.They cooperate stimulating new initiatives and piloting new projects in the areas of RWH. They establish transparent information and knowledge sharing system and they will exchange expertise when needed.They join strategies to facilitate capacity development activities in the national, regional and international levels.

RAIN and Spate Irrigation Network have mutual interest in promoting RWH for enhancing food security of poor communities and marginalized groups. Both organizations are based in the Netherlands.They are active in Asia, Eastern and western Africa and SPN is also active in the Middle East. Most of the implementation regions are poverty stricken and face chronic food insecurity. Their collaboration strengthen their presence on the field and help them to attain their goals more effectively.They will mobilize their experts and resources in RWH, 3R, irrigation to build the capacity of local organizations and communities in RWH and food security. Together, they plan to catalyze and pilot innovative RWH technologies and approaches in the different regions.

RAIN foundation and Spate Irrigation Network have formed partnership to collaborate in promoting RWH in local, national, regional and international level. The partnership is aimed to strengthen the lobbying and capacity development activities of both organization. Both organizations recognize the need for partnership and collaboration for reaching wider target and mobilize different resources. This project will mainly focus on the use of RWH for food security.

The objectives of the project are to -Bring together diversity of actors focusing on Easter and western Africa, Asia and the Middle East -Provide access to each other's database -Join forces to promote and lobby RWH to policy makers
